   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(gen_tcp_socket_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -compile([export_all, nowarn_export_all]).
   24: 
   25: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct_event.hrl").
   26: 
   27: all() ->
   28:     [{group, smoketest}].
   29: 
   30: groups() ->
   31:     [{smoketest,  [{group,small}]},
   32:      {benchmark,  [{group,small}, {group,medium},
   33:                    {group,large}, {group,huge}]},
   34:      %%
   35:      {dev,             backend_groups(dev)},
   36:      {dev_inet,        testcases(dev)},
   37:      {dev_socket,      testcases(dev)},
   38:      {dev_direct,      testcases(direct)},
   39:      {dev_inet_nra,    testcases(dev)}, % _nra: no read_ahead,
   40:      {dev_socket_nra,  testcases(dev)}, %       i.e {read_ahead,false}
   41:      {dev_direct_nra,  testcases(direct)},
   42:      %%
   43:      {small,      backend_groups(normal)},
   44:      {medium,     backend_groups(normal)},
   45:      {large,      backend_groups(normal)},
   46:      {huge,       backend_groups(normal)},
   47:      {inet,       testcases(active)},
   48:      {socket,     testcases(active)},
   49:      {direct,     testcases(direct)},
   50:      {inet_nra,   testcases(active)},
   51:      {socket_nra, testcases(active)},
   52:      {direct_nra, testcases(direct)}].
   53: 
   54: backend_groups(dev) ->
   55:     [{group,dev_inet},      {group,dev_socket},     {group,dev_direct},
   56:      {group,dev_inet_nra},  {group,dev_socket_nra}, {group,dev_direct_nra}];
   57: backend_groups(normal) ->
   58:     [{group,inet},      {group,socket},     {group,direct},
   59:      {group,inet_nra},  {group,socket_nra}, {group,direct_nra}].
   60: 
   61: testcases(active) ->
   62:     [active_raw, active_false, active_true,
   63:      active_once, active_1, active_5, active_20];
   64: testcases(dev) ->
   65:     [active_raw, active_false, active_true, active_once, active_20];
   66: testcases(direct) ->
   67:     [socket_raw, socket_packet, socket_packet_buf, socket_packet_cheat].
   68: 
   69: -define(SUITE, "gen_tcp_socket").
   70: -define(DOMAIN, inet).
   71: %% *_EXP is a power of 2 exponent so the resulting value is
   72: %% 1 bsl ?*_EXP
   73: -define(NORM_EXP, 30). % Total byte size norm: packet size * number of packets
   74: -define(BUFSIZE_EXP, 17).
   75: -define(BUFSIZE, (1 bsl ?BUFSIZE_EXP)).
   76: 
   77: -define(DBG(Term), dbg(?FUNCTION_NAME, ?LINE, begin Term end)).
   78: 
   79: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   80:     case socket:is_supported(protocols, tcp) of
   81:         true ->
   82:             ct:log("socket:info():~n    ~p~n", [socket:info()]),
   83:             {ok, BindAddr} = kernel_test_lib:which_local_addr(?DOMAIN),
   84:             [{bind_addr, #{ family => ?DOMAIN, addr   => BindAddr }}
   85:             | Config];
   86:         false ->
   87:             {skip, "Socket not supported"}
   88:     end.
   89: 
   90: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   91:     ct:log("socket:info():~n    ~p~n", [socket:info()]),
   92:     ok.
   93: 
   94: 
   95: init_per_group(Nm, Config) ->
   96:     case Nm of
   97:         %% 'burden' shifts the number of packets left
   98:         smoketest   -> [{burden,0} | Config];
   99:         benchmark   -> [{burden,2} | Config]; % 4 times the number of packets
  100:         dev ->
  101:             init_per_group_size(?BUFSIZE_EXP + 4,  0, [{burden,3} | Config]);
  102:         %%
  103:         dev_inet    -> init_per_group(inet,     Config);
  104:         dev_socket  -> init_per_group(socket,   Config);
  105:         dev_direct  -> init_per_group(direct,   Config);
  106:         %%
  107:         %% For small packets we cannot have the total size 2^?NORM_EXP
  108:         %% since the message passing overhead (latency) starts to dominate
  109:         %% so we have to subtract some from the exponent to get
  110:         %% roughly the same running time
  111:         small   -> init_per_group_size(7,  -3, Config);
  112:         medium  -> init_per_group_size(10, -1, Config);
  113:         large   -> init_per_group_size(15,  0, Config);
  114:         huge    -> init_per_group_size(?BUFSIZE_EXP + 2, 0, Config);
  115:         %%
  116:         inet_nra        -> init_per_group_nra(inet,         Config);
  117:         socket_nra      -> init_per_group_nra(socket,       Config);
  118:         direct_nra      -> init_per_group_nra(direct,       Config);
  119:         dev_inet_nra    -> init_per_group_nra(dev_inet,     Config);
  120:         dev_socket_nra  -> init_per_group_nra(dev_socket,   Config);
  121:         dev_direct_nra  -> init_per_group_nra(dev_direct,   Config);
  122:         _ when Nm =:= inet;
  123:                Nm =:= socket;
  124:                Nm =:= direct -> [{backend,Nm} | Config]
  125:     end.
  126: 
  127: init_per_group_size(K, Adj, Config) ->
  128:     {_, Burden} = proplists:lookup(burden, Config),
  129:     %%
  130:     %% 2^?NORM_EXP  = Number of bytes to transfer, unadjusted
  131:     %% 2^(?NORM_EXP + Burden + Adj) = -"-, adjusted
  132:     %%
  133:     %% 2^K          = Mean packet size
  134:     %% 2^(K+1)      = Max packet size
  135:     %% N = 2^M      = Number of packets;
  136:     %%
  137:     M = ?NORM_EXP - K + Burden + Adj,
  138:     N = 1 bsl M,
  139:     StopTag = spawn_testdata_server(K+1, N),
  140:      %%
  141:     {MeanSize, SizeSuffix} = size_and_suffix(1 bsl K),
  142:     {PacketCount, CountSuffix} = size_and_suffix(N),
  143:     ct:log("Packet mean size: ~w ~sByte, packet count: ~w ~s",
  144:            [MeanSize, SizeSuffix, PacketCount, CountSuffix]),
  145:     %%
  146:     [{testdata_server, StopTag},
  147:      {testdata_size,   {K, M}} | Config].
  148: 
  149: init_per_group_nra(Name, Config) ->
  150:     init_per_group(Name, [{read_ahead,false} | Config]).
  151: 
  152: end_per_group(Nm, Config) ->
  153:     case Nm of
  154:         dev_inet        -> end_per_group(inet,      Config);
  155:         dev_socket      -> end_per_group(socket,    Config);
  156:         dev_direct      -> end_per_group(direct,    Config);
  157:         inet_nra        -> end_per_group_nra(inet,  Config);
  158:         socket_nra      -> end_per_group_nra(socket,    Config);
  159:         direct_nra      -> end_per_group_nra(direct,    Config);
  160:         dev_inet_nra    -> end_per_group_nra(dev_inet,  Config);
  161:         dev_socket_nra  -> end_per_group_nra(dev_socket, Config);
  162:         dev_direct_nra  -> end_per_group_nra(dev_direct, Config);
  163:         %%
  164:         dev -> proplists:delete(burden, end_per_group_size(Config));
  165:         _ when Nm =:= smoketest;
  166:                Nm =:= benchmark -> proplists:delete(burden, Config);
  167:         _ when Nm =:= small;
  168:                Nm =:= medium;
  169:                Nm =:= large;
  170:                Nm =:= huge      -> end_per_group_size(Config);
  171:         _ when Nm =:= inet;
  172:                Nm =:= socket;
  173:                Nm =:= direct    -> proplists:delete(backend, Config)
  174:     end.
  175: 
  176: end_per_group_size(Config) ->
  177:     {_, StopTag} = proplists:lookup(testdata_server, Config),
  178:     stop_testdata_server(StopTag),
  179:     proplists:delete(
  180:       testdata_server, proplists:delete(testdata_size, Config)).
  181: 
  182: end_per_group_nra(Name, Config) ->
  183:     proplists:delete(read_ahead, end_per_group(Name, Config)).
  184: 
  185: 
  186: size_and_suffix(P) ->
  187:     size_and_suffix(P, 1, ["", "K", "M", "T", "Z"]).
  188: %%
  189: size_and_suffix(P, _, []) ->
  190:     {P, ""};
  191: size_and_suffix(P, Q, Suffixes) ->
  192:     Q_1 = Q bsl 10,
  193:     if
  194:         is_integer(P), Q_1 =< P, P band (Q_1 - 1) =:= 0 ->
  195:             size_and_suffix(P, Q_1, tl(Suffixes));
  196:         Q bsl 13 =< P ->
  197:             size_and_suffix(P, Q_1, tl(Suffixes));
  198:         true ->
  199:             {round(P / Q), hd(Suffixes)}
  200:     end.
  201: 
  202: %% -------
  203: %% Testcases
  204: 
  205: -define(
  206:    XFER(Name),
  207:    Name(Config) -> xfer(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME)).
  208: 
  209: ?XFER(active_raw).
  210: ?XFER(active_false).
  211: ?XFER(active_true).
  212: ?XFER(active_once).
  213: ?XFER(active_1).
  214: ?XFER(active_5).
  215: ?XFER(active_20).
  216: ?XFER(socket_raw).
  217: ?XFER(socket_packet).
  218: ?XFER(socket_packet_buf).
  219: ?XFER(socket_packet_cheat).
  220: 
  221: %% -------
  222: 
  223: tc2active(TC) ->
  224:     case TC of
  225:         active_raw      -> raw;
  226:         active_false    -> false;
  227:         active_true     -> true;
  228:         active_once     -> once;
  229:         active_1        -> 1;
  230:         active_5        -> 5;
  231:         active_20       -> 20
  232:     end.
  233: 
  234: xfer(Config, TC) when is_list(Config) ->
  235:     Params =
  236:         #{ Key => Value ||
  237:              {Key, Value} <- Config,
  238:              lists:member(
  239:                Key, [backend, read_ahead, bind_addr, testdata_size]) },
  240:     run_xfer(TC, Params, testdata()).
  241: 
  242: run_xfer(
  243:   TC, #{ bind_addr := BindAddr } = Params,
  244:   #{iovecs       := Iovecs,
  245:     packet_sizes := PacketSizes,
  246:     total_size   := TotalSize}) ->
  247:     %%
  248:     Parent = self(),
  249:     Tag = make_ref(),
  250:     {Sender, Mref} =
  251:         spawn_opt(
  252:           fun () ->
  253:                   try
  254:                       %% Send iovecs efficiently
  255:                       {ok, L} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{ifaddr,BindAddr}]),
  256:                       {ok, {IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
  257:                       Sockaddr = #{family => inet, addr => IP, port => Port},
  258:                       Parent ! {Tag, Sockaddr},
  259:                       {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
  260:                       ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
  261:                       ok = inet:setopts(A, [{sndbuf, ?BUFSIZE}]),
  262:                       send_loop(A, Iovecs),
  263:                       ok = gen_tcp:close(A)
  264:                   catch Class : Reason : Stacktrace ->
  265:                           ct:log(
  266:                             "Sender crash [~w] ~w : ~p~n    ~p~n",
  267:                             [self(), Class, Reason, Stacktrace]),
  268:                           erlang:raise(Class, Reason, Stacktrace)
  269:                   end
  270:           end, [monitor]),
  271:     receive
  272:         {Tag, Sockaddr} ->
  273:             ct:log("try connect to ~p"
  274:                    "~n   TC:      ~p"
  275:                    "~n", [Sockaddr, TC]),
  276:             C = case connect(Params, Sockaddr, TC) of
  277:                     {ok, CSock} ->
  278:                         CSock;
  279:                     {error, eaddrnotavail = CReason} ->
  280:                         exit({skip, CReason});
  281:                     {error, CReason} ->
  282:                         ct:fail({connect_failed, CReason})
  283:                 end,
  284:             try
  285:                 T1 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  286:                 assert({ok, TotalSize}, recv_loop(C, PacketSizes, TC)),
  287:                 T2 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  288:                 T = erlang:convert_time_unit(T2 - T1, native, millisecond),
  289:                 report_MByte_s(Params, TC, TotalSize, T)
  290:             catch Class : Reason : Stacktrace ->
  291:                     ct:log(
  292:                       "Receiver crash [~w] ~w : ~p~n    ~p~n",
  293:                       [self(), Class, Reason, Stacktrace]),
  294:                     exit(Sender, receiver_crash),
  295:                     %% spawn_link of Sender does not work since
  296:                     %% ct catches the below failure so this process
  297:                     %% doesn't die and the link doesn't trigger,
  298:                     %% therefore the explicit exit/2 above
  299:                     %%
  300:                     erlang:raise(Class, Reason, Stacktrace)
  301:             after
  302:                 close(Params, C),
  303:                 receive {'DOWN',Mref,_,_,_} -> ok end
  304:             end;
  305:         {'DOWN',Mref,_,_,Reason} ->
  306:             error({sender_died,Reason})
  307:     end.
  308: 
  309: send_loop(_S, []) ->
  310:     ok;
  311: send_loop(S, [Iovec | Iovecs]) ->
  312:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S, Iovec),
  313:     send_loop(S, Iovecs).
  314: 
  315: 
  316: connect(#{ backend := direct }, Sockaddr, _) ->
  317:     {ok, S} = socket:open(?DOMAIN, stream),
  318:     ok = socket:bind(S, any),
  319:     ok = socket:setopt(S, {socket,rcvbuf}, ?BUFSIZE),
  320:     ok = socket:setopt(S, {otp,rcvbuf},    ?BUFSIZE),
  321:     io:format("socket:connect [~p].~n", [Sockaddr]),
  322:     case socket:connect(S, Sockaddr) of
  323:         ok ->
  324:             {ok, S};
  325:         Error ->
  326:             Error
  327:     end;
  328: connect(#{ backend := Backend } = Params, Sockaddr, active_raw) ->
  329:     %% {active,true}, {packet,raw}
  330:     Opts =
  331:         [{inet_backend,Backend}, binary, {active,true},
  332:          ?DOMAIN, {recbuf,?BUFSIZE}] ++
  333:         case Params of
  334:             #{ read_ahead := false } -> [{read_ahead,false}];
  335:             #{} -> []
  336:         end,
  337:     io:format("gen_tcp:connect(~p, ~p).~n", [Sockaddr, Opts]),
  338:     gen_tcp:connect(Sockaddr, Opts);
  339: connect(#{ backend := Backend } = Params, Sockaddr, TC) ->
  340:     Opts =
  341:         [{inet_backend,Backend}, binary, {active,tc2active(TC)}, {packet,4},
  342:          ?DOMAIN, {recbuf,?BUFSIZE}] ++
  343:         case Params of
  344:             #{ read_ahead := false } -> [{read_ahead,false}];
  345:             #{} -> []
  346:         end,
  347:     io:format("gen_tcp:connect(~p, ~p).~n", [Sockaddr, Opts]),
  348:     gen_tcp:connect(Sockaddr, Opts).
  349: 
  350: 
  351: close(#{ backend := direct }, S) ->
  352:     socket:close(S);
  353: close(#{ backend := _}, S) ->
  354:     gen_tcp:close(S).
  355: 
  356: 
  357: report_MByte_s(
  358:   #{ backend := Backend, testdata_size := {K, M} } = Params, TC, Size, Time) ->
  359:     ct:log("Size: ~w. Time: ~w.", [Size, Time]),
  360:     ReadAhead =
  361:         case Params of
  362:             #{ read_ahead := false } -> nra;
  363:             #{}                      -> ra
  364:         end,
  365:     Name =
  366:         io_lib:format("~w-~w 2^(~w+~w)-~w", [Backend, ReadAhead, K, M, TC]),
  367:     {Value, Suffix} = size_and_suffix(Size * 1000 / Time),
  368:     report(Name, Value, Suffix++"Byte/s").
  369: 
  370: 
  371: spawn_testdata_server(K, N) ->
  372:     Spawner   = self(),
  373:     Tag       = make_ref(),
  374:     {_, Mref} =
  375:         spawn_opt(
  376:           fun () ->
  377:                   register(?MODULE, self()),
  378:                   Testdata = generate_testdata(K, N),
  379:                   Spawner ! Tag,
  380:                   testdata_server(Tag, Testdata)
  381:           end, [monitor]),
  382:     receive
  383:         Tag ->
  384:             demonitor(Mref, [flush]),
  385:             Tag;
  386:         {'DOWN', Mref, _, _, Info} ->
  387:             error(Info)
  388:     end.
  389: 
  390: testdata_server(Tag, Testdata) ->
  391:     receive
  392:         {get, From} ->
  393:             From ! {From, Testdata},
  394:             testdata_server(Tag, Testdata);
  395:         Tag ->
  396:             ok
  397:     end.
  398: 
  399: stop_testdata_server(Tag) when is_reference(Tag) ->
  400:     case whereis(?MODULE) of
  401:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
  402:             Ref = monitor(process, Pid),
  403:             Pid ! Tag,
  404:             receive {'DOWN', Ref, _, _, _} -> ok end
  405:     end.
  406: 
  407: testdata() ->
  408:     case whereis(?MODULE) of
  409:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
  410:             Ref = monitor(process, ?MODULE, [{alias,reply_demonitor}]),
  411:             Pid ! {get, Ref},
  412:             receive
  413:                 {Ref, Testdata} ->
  414:                     Testdata;
  415:                 {'DOWN', Ref, _, _, Info} ->
  416:                     error(Info)
  417:             end
  418:     end.
  419: 
  420: generate_testdata(K, N) ->
  421:     %% 2^K = Max packet size
  422:     %% N   = Number of packets
  423:     %%
  424:     Offsets        =  generate_offsets(K, N),
  425:     DataBlock      =  create_data_block(1 bsl K),
  426:     Iovecs         =  generate_iovecs(Offsets, DataBlock, 1000),
  427:     DataBlockSize  =  byte_size(DataBlock),
  428:     PacketSizes    =  packet_sizes(Offsets, DataBlockSize),
  429:     TotalSize      =  total_size(Offsets, DataBlockSize),
  430:     #{iovecs       => Iovecs,
  431:       packet_sizes => PacketSizes,
  432:       total_size   => TotalSize}.
  433: 
  434: 
  435: packet_sizes(Offsets, DataBlockSize) ->
  436:     [DataBlockSize - Offset - 4 || Offset <- Offsets].
  437: 
  438: total_size([], _DataBlockSize) -> 0;
  439: total_size([Offset | Offsets], DataBlockSize) ->
  440:     DataBlockSize - Offset + total_size(Offsets, DataBlockSize).
  441: 
  442: generate_iovecs([], _DataBlock, _ChunkSize) -> [];
  443: generate_iovecs(Offsets, DataBlock, ChunkSize) ->
  444:     {Offsets_1, Iovecs} = generate_iovec(Offsets, DataBlock, ChunkSize),
  445:     [Iovecs | generate_iovecs(Offsets_1, DataBlock, ChunkSize)].
  446: 
  447: generate_iovec(Offsets, DataBlock, N) ->
  448:     generate_iovec(Offsets, DataBlock, N, []).
  449: %%
  450: generate_iovec(Offsets, _DataBlock, N, Acc)
  451:   when N =:= 0;
  452:        Offsets =:= [], is_integer(N), 0 < N ->
  453:     {Offsets, lists:reverse(Acc)};
  454: generate_iovec([Offset | Offsets], DataBlock, N, Acc)
  455:   when is_integer(N), 0 < N ->
  456:     <<_:Offset/binary, Bin/binary>> = DataBlock,
  457:     generate_iovec(Offsets, DataBlock, N - 1, [Bin | Acc]).
  458: 
  459: %% 0 =< Offset < 2^K - 1
  460: %% Offset mod 4 == 0
  461: generate_offsets(K, N) when is_integer(K), 6 =< K ->
  462:     %% 3 here corresponds to the 8 iterations below,
  463:     %% and 2 corresponds to the bsl 2 that makes mod 4 == 0
  464:     Range = 1 bsl (K - (3 + 2)),
  465:     generate_offsets(Range, N, []).
  466: %%
  467: generate_offsets(_Range, 0, Offsets) ->
  468:     Offsets;
  469: generate_offsets(Range, N, Offsets) when is_integer(N), 0 < N ->
  470:     Offset = (rand_sum(Range, 8) - 8) bsl 2,
  471:     generate_offsets(Range, N - 1, [Offset | Offsets]).
  472: 
  473: %% Sum I number of rand:uniform values range N
  474: %%
  475: rand_sum(_, 0) -> 0;
  476: rand_sum(N, I) -> rand:uniform(N) + rand_sum(N, I - 1).
  477: 
  478: %% Create a data block that at every offset mod 4 == 0
  479: %% contains that number of bytes after, so at every
  480: %% such offset up to the end of the data block
  481: %% there is a valid packet 4 chunk
  482: %%
  483: create_data_block(M) -> create_data_block(M, <<>>).
  484: %%
  485: create_data_block(M, Bin) when is_integer(M), 4 =< M ->
  486:     %% M   :: Desired chunk size
  487:     %% Bin :: Accumulator, grows at the end
  488:     create_data_block(M - 4, <<Bin/binary, M:32>>);
  489: create_data_block(3 = M, Bin) -> <<Bin/binary, M:32, 3, 2, 1>>;
  490: create_data_block(2 = M, Bin) -> <<Bin/binary, M:32, 2, 1>>;
  491: create_data_block(1 = M, Bin) -> <<Bin/binary, M:32, 1>>;
  492: create_data_block(0 = M, Bin) -> <<Bin/binary, M:32>>.
  493: 
  494: 
  495: %% Receive all packets on the stream, return the total payload size
  496: %%
  497: recv_loop(S, Sizes, TC) ->
  498:     case TC of
  499:         socket_raw ->
  500:             Recv = fun (Socket) -> socket:recv(Socket, 0) end,
  501:             recv_loop_raw(S, 0, Recv);
  502:         socket_packet ->
  503:             recv_loop_packet(S, Sizes, 0, fun socket:recv/2);
  504:         socket_packet_buf ->
  505:             recv_loop_packet_buf(S, Sizes, 0, fun socket:recv/2);
  506:         socket_packet_cheat ->
  507:             recv_loop_packet_cheat(S, Sizes, 0, fun socket:recv/2);
  508:         active_raw ->
  509:             recv_loop_active_raw(S, 0);
  510:         active_false ->
  511:             Recv = fun (Socket) -> gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0) end,
  512:             recv_loop_active_false(S, Sizes, 0, Recv);
  513:         active_true ->
  514:             recv_loop_active_true(S, Sizes, 0);
  515:         active_once ->
  516:             recv_loop_active_once(S, Sizes, 0);
  517:         _ ->
  518:             recv_loop_active_n(S, Sizes, 0, tc2active(TC))
  519:     end.
  520: 
  521: %% -------
  522: %% These ignore packet borders and just count the total number of bytes
  523: 
  524: recv_loop_active_raw(S, M) ->
  525:     receive
  526:         {tcp, S, Data} ->
  527:             DataSize = byte_size(Data),
  528:             recv_loop_active_raw(S, M + DataSize);
  529:         {tcp_closed, S} ->
  530:             {ok, M};
  531:         {tcp_error, S, Reason} ->
  532:             {error, Reason}
  533:     end.
  534: 
  535: recv_loop_raw(S, M, Recv) ->
  536:     case Recv(S) of
  537:         {ok, Data} ->
  538:             DataSize = byte_size(Data),
  539:             recv_loop_raw(S, M + DataSize, Recv);
  540:         {error, closed} ->
  541:             {ok, M};
  542:         {error, _} = Error ->
  543:             Error
  544:     end.
  545: 
  546: %% -------
  547: %% These implement {packet,4}
  548: 
  549: %% Read packet header then packet body with separate Recv calls
  550: %%
  551: recv_loop_packet(_S, [], M, _Recv) ->
  552:     {ok, M};
  553: recv_loop_packet(S, [Size|Sizes], M, Recv) ->
  554:     case Recv(S, 4) of
  555:         {ok, <<Size:32>>} ->
  556:             case Recv(S, Size) of
  557:                 {ok, Bin} when is_binary(Bin) ->
  558:                     recv_loop_packet(S, Sizes, M + 4 + Size, Recv);
  559:                 Err2 ->
  560:                     Err2
  561:             end;
  562:         Err1 ->
  563:             Err1
  564:     end.
  565: 
  566: %% Use Recv(0) and then parse the received binary into packets.
  567: %%
  568: recv_loop_packet_buf(S, Sizes, M, Recv) ->
  569:     case Recv(S, 0) of
  570:         {ok, Data} when 0 < byte_size(Data) ->
  571:             recv_loop_packet_buf(S, Sizes, M, Recv, Data);
  572:         {error, closed} ->
  573:             [] = Sizes,
  574:             {ok, M};
  575:         {error, _} = Error ->
  576:             Error
  577:     end.
  578: %%
  579: recv_loop_packet_buf(S, Sizes, M, Recv, Buf) ->
  580:     %% Buf is a binary(), no fancy queue
  581:     %%
  582:     case Buf of
  583:         <<PacketSize:32, _:PacketSize/binary, Rest/binary>> ->
  584:             assert(PacketSize, hd(Sizes)),
  585:             NewM = M + 4 + PacketSize,
  586:             recv_loop_packet_buf(S, tl(Sizes), NewM, Recv, Rest);
  587:         <<PacketSize:32, Start/binary>> ->
  588:             %% Partial packet.
  589:             %% Keep it simple and read the rest of the packet with Recv(N).
  590:             %% We could also Recv(0) to get more data but that
  591:             %% would complicate handling of Start + Rest.
  592:             %% This is hopefully a rare case for small packets
  593:             %% and a small overhead for large packets..
  594:             RestSize = PacketSize - byte_size(Start),
  595:             case Recv(S, RestSize) of
  596:                 {ok, Rest} when byte_size(Rest) =:= RestSize->
  597:                     Packet = <<Start/binary, Rest/binary>>,
  598:                     assert(PacketSize, byte_size(Packet)),
  599:                     NewM = M + 4 + PacketSize,
  600:                     assert(PacketSize, hd(Sizes)),
  601:                     recv_loop_packet_buf(S, tl(Sizes), NewM, Recv);
  602:                 {error, _} = Error ->
  603:                     Error
  604:             end;
  605:         <<>> ->
  606:             recv_loop_packet_buf(S, Sizes, M, Recv);
  607:         <<Head/binary>> ->
  608:             %% Partial header.
  609:             %% Keep it simple and just Recv(N) the rest of the header.
  610:             %% Using Recv(0) would complicate the code greatly.
  611:             %% This is hopefully a rare case for small packets
  612:             %% and a small overhead for large packets..
  613:             RestSize = 4 - byte_size(Head),
  614:             case Recv(S, RestSize) of
  615:                 {ok, Rest} when byte_size(Rest) =:= RestSize->
  616:                     Data = <<Head/binary, Rest/binary>>,
  617:                     recv_loop_packet_buf(S, Sizes, M, Recv, Data);
  618:                 {error, _} = Error ->
  619:                     Error
  620:             end
  621:     end.
  622: 
  623: %% Cheating - we know the next packet size and receive exactly
  624: %% that in one Recv call, and verify the packet header
  625: %%
  626: recv_loop_packet_cheat(_S, [], M, _Recv) ->
  627:     {ok, M};
  628: recv_loop_packet_cheat(S, [Size|Sizes], M, Recv) ->
  629:     case Recv(S, 4 + Size) of
  630:         {ok, <<Size:32, _:Size/binary>>} ->
  631:             recv_loop_packet_cheat(S, Sizes, M + 4 + Size, Recv);
  632:         {ok, Data} ->
  633:             {error,{bad_packet,Data,Size}};
  634:         Err1 ->
  635:             Err1
  636:     end.
  637: 
  638: %% -------
  639: %% These assume that the socket is in {packet,4} mode
  640: 
  641: recv_loop_active_false(S, Sizes, M, Recv) ->
  642:     case Recv(S) of
  643:         {ok, Data} ->
  644:             DataSize = byte_size(Data),
  645:             assert(DataSize, hd(Sizes)),
  646:             recv_loop_active_false(S, tl(Sizes), M + DataSize + 4, Recv);
  647:         {error, closed} ->
  648:             [] = Sizes,
  649:             {ok, M};
  650:         {error, _} = Error ->
  651:             Error
  652:     end.
  653: 
  654: recv_loop_active_true(S, Sizes, M) ->
  655:     receive
  656:         {tcp, S, Data} ->
  657:             DataSize = byte_size(Data),
  658:             assert(DataSize, hd(Sizes)),
  659:             recv_loop_active_true(S, tl(Sizes), M + DataSize + 4);
  660:         {tcp_closed, S} ->
  661:             Sizes = [],
  662:             {ok, M};
  663:         {tcp_error, S, Reason} ->
  664:             {error, Reason}
  665:     end.
  666: 
  667: recv_loop_active_once(S, Sizes, M) ->
  668:     receive
  669:         {tcp, S, Data} ->
  670:             DataSize = byte_size(Data),
  671:             assert(DataSize, hd(Sizes)),
  672:             ok = inet:setopts(S, [{active,once}]),
  673:             recv_loop_active_once(S, tl(Sizes), M + DataSize + 4);
  674:         {tcp_closed, S} ->
  675:             Sizes = [],
  676:             {ok, M};
  677:         {tcp_error, S, Reason} ->
  678:             {error, Reason}
  679:     end.
  680: 
  681: recv_loop_active_n(S, Sizes, M, N) ->
  682:     receive
  683:         {tcp, S, Data} ->
  684:             DataSize = byte_size(Data),
  685:             assert(DataSize, hd(Sizes)),
  686:             recv_loop_active_n(S, tl(Sizes), M + DataSize + 4, N);
  687:         {tcp_passive, S} ->
  688:             ok = inet:setopts(S, [{active,N}]),
  689:             recv_loop_active_n(S, Sizes, M, N);
  690:         {tcp_closed, S} ->
  691:             Sizes = [],
  692:             {ok, M};
  693:         {tcp_error, S, Reason} ->
  694:             {error, Reason}
  695:     end.
  696: 
  697: %% -------
  698: 
  699: report(Name, Value, Suffix) ->
  700:     ct:log("### ~s: ~w ~s", [Name, Value, Suffix]),
  701:     ct_event:notify(
  702:       #event{
  703:          name = benchmark_data,
  704:          data = [{value, Value}, {suite, ?SUITE}, {name, Name}]}),
  705:     {comment, term_to_string(Value) ++ " " ++ Suffix}.
  706: 
  707: term_to_string(Term) ->
  708:     unicode:characters_to_list(io_lib:write(Term, [{encoding, unicode}])).
  709: 
  710: -compile({inline, [assert/2]}).
  711: assert(X, X) -> ok;
  712: assert(X, Y) -> error({assert, X, Y}).
  713: 
  714: 
  715: -ifdef(undefined).
  716: ts() -> ts(erlang:system_info(start_time)).
  717: 
  718: ts(TS) ->
  719:     erlang:convert_time_unit(st() - TS, native, microsecond).
  720: 
  721: st() -> erlang:monotonic_time().
  722: 
  723: dbg(Function, Line, Term) ->
  724:     erlang:display({self(), {?MODULE, Function, Line}, Term}).
  725: -endif.
